page.title: 19Our family during the strike
page.content: My dad is Administration Officer at {South Kirkby Colliery.}It changed in our house during the strike not because of money,for he got well paid,but because we always watched the news.Usually we only watch B.B.C.1 but we watched all the channels.My dad used to talk about the strike with my mum all the time.I preferred to play out with my friends all the time.The strange thing was nobody hated my dad because he went to work.{J.Lloyd} {Women's Action group During the strike There were two action groups one for Kirkby men,the other for Frickley men.Their action group had the nickname Flag. They distributed food parcels,vouchers and raised money by organised raffles and jumble sales. Some ladies ran a soup kitchen at the Social Centre in South Elmsall.They also organised marches.{B.Smith
